ai.summary: A 10.8 km moderate trail through Moydamlaght Forest with a viewpoint at Eagles Rock. The route offers shaded woodland, variable terrain, and a rewarding outlook for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Forest paths predominate with uneven ground, tree roots, and occasional rocky sections near Eagles Rock. Conditions can be damp and slippery after rain; expect shaded sections with limited sun exposure.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the weather before departure; UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy waterproof hiking boots and use a map or GPS to stay on track. Drink water and bring snacks; carry a fully charged phone. Hike with a companion when possible and share your plan with someone. Be cautious near the Eagles Rock viewpoint and avoid edges in windy or wet conditions. Respect wildlife and follow Leave No Trace principles.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Emergency blanket or lightweight extra layer
Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) for sunny days
Phone with offline maps and charged battery
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) typically offers milder weather and better visibility in the UK, though trail conditions can be muddy in winter. Plan according to conditions.
